author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Canisius Falls Short in Loss to St. Bonaventure
text:
Canisius Falls Short in Loss to St. Bonaventure
By the Numbers
Canisius men's soccer faced defeat against St. Bonaventure, losing 2-1 despite a strong offensive effort in the second half. The Bonnies opened the scoring early, with goals from Andres Javitt and Luc Finelli. Although Canisius cut the deficit with a goal from Edson Flores, they were unable to capitalize on multiple late scoring opportunities. As a result, Canisius falls to 0-3-0 in non-conference play, while St. Bonaventure secures their first victory of the season.
- Canisius outshot St. Bonaventure 17-14, including a 10-9 edge on corner kicks.
- Edson Flores' goal marked his first of the season and first of his collegiate career.
- St. Bonaventure leads the all-time series against Canisius with a record of 28-18-9.
Despite Canisius dominating the shot count, their inability to convert scoring chances in the closing minutes illustrates ongoing struggles in finishing plays. Defensive efforts, notably by senior Kodie Sarkodie, bolstered their effort, yet the Griffs remain winless this season.State of Play
- Canisius remains winless at 0-3-0 after three non-conference matches.
- St. Bonaventure marked their first win of the season, improving to 1-2-0.
The Griffs will host Central Connecticut State for a Labor Day matchup at 1:00 p.m., aiming to turn their fortunes around and secure their first win of the season.Bottom Line
Canisius must capitalize on scoring opportunities in upcoming matches to shift their current trajectory; a focus on offensive execution will be crucial as they continue their non-conference schedule.
